com.siemens.bt.jazz.services.base.router.tree

Class ConcurrentTreeRouter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siemens.bt.jazz.services.base.router.tree.ConcurrentTreeRouter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Router

    public class ConcurrentTreeRouter
extends Object
implements Router
    REST request router implementation, internally using a tree data structure.

    For a given rest path and method, this class retrieves the correct action builder and builds the corresponding action. This especially facilitates passing the correct parameters to all services, as it acts as a single entry point to all constructed services.

        Uses an ActionTree to determine which service needs to be built.

        request - The original HTTP Request

      • addService

        public void addService(com.ibm.team.jfs.app.http.util.HttpConstants.HttpMethod method,
                       String path,
                       ServiceFactory factory)
        Adds a service with a method, a full URL path and a builder class.

        If a path is added twice, it will be overridden.

        Specified by:
        addService in interface Router
        Parameters:
        method - A REST method (GET/POST/etc.)
        path - A full path in standard url form /like/this/please
        factory - Factory to use when building rest actions

      • formatResponseDefault

        private void formatResponseDefault(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        Set standard response headers.

        This shouldn't really be here, as it doesn't functionally belong to this class. There should be a much nicer way to expose this functionality "globally"
